name: Cornbread Biscotti
author: HappyGrandma
summary: A fun and yummy side for chili, soups, or stews. Can be an appetizer by cutting into shorter pieces and serve with a dip, spread, or salsa.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper
Stir melted butter and garlic powder together in a bowl
Turn cornbread out onto a cutting board
Thinly slice crusts from each of the short ends and discard
Cut cornbread in half lengthwise; cut into 4 1/2 x 1/2-inch slices
Brush both sides of each piece with butter mixture using a pastry brush
Arrange slices on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until tops are golden and crisp, 4 to 6 minutes
Flip biscotti and continue baking until top side is golden and crispy, 4 to 6 more minutes
